meta_description.text: 03-Apr-2013 — Disney has laid off the staff of LucasArts and cancelled all current projects. Staff were informed of the shutdown this morning, ...

people_also_ask.heading: Disney has shut down LucasArts. The Mouse House announced today that it will be laying off all 150 people at the game publishing division of Lucasfilm. Current projects, "Star Wars: First Assault" and the much-hyped "Star Wars 1313" have been cancelled. ... Disney purchased Lucasfilm October of last year for $4 billion.03-Apr-2013
people_also_ask.title: Disney Shuts Down LucasArts Video Game Company

people_also_ask.heading: Disney have rebranded the Lucasfilm video games division, this time sending the Star Wars lords back to a name from 1986: Lucasfilm Games. ... Because Disney run time on a loop, presumably they'll rebrand to LucasArts in 2025, essentially close it down in 2048, then return to Lucasfilm Games in 2056.12-Jan-2021
people_also_ask.title: The Lucasfilm Games brand is back | Rock Paper Shotgun

people_also_ask.heading: On October 30, 2012, LucasArts was acquired by The Walt Disney Company through the acquisition of its parent company Lucasfilm in a deal for $4.05 billion.
people_also_ask.title: LucasArts | Disney Wiki

people_also_ask.heading: LucasArts (traded as LucasArts Entertainment Company, LLC) was an American action-adventure video game developer and publisher based in San Francisco, California. It was founded in 1982 by George Lucas as the video game development group of his film company, Lucasfilm.
